callback.name: onConstruct
callback.description: Called when the script is loaded into the bot.

callback.name: onDestruct
callback.description: Called when the script is removed.

callback.name: onConnect
callback.description: Called either when the bot connects to the network, or when script is loaded, whatever is first.

callback.name: onDisconnect
callback.description: Called either when the bot disconnects from the network.

callback.name: onChannelJoin
callback.description: Called when someone joins the channel.

callback.name: onChannelPart
callback.description: Called when someone parts the channel.

callback.name: onChannelKick
callback.description: Called when someone is kicked from the channel.

prototype.string: public function onChannelKick(CoreChannel $sChannel, CoreUser $sAdminUser, CoreUser $sKickedUser, string $sReason)

callback.name: onChannelTopic
callback.description: Called when the channel's topic has been changed.

callback.name: onUserNotice
callback.description: Called when the channel or bot recieves a NOTICE command.

callback.name: onChannelMessage
callback.description: Called when there is talk in the channel.

callback.name: onChannelCommand
callback.description: Called when someone in the channel issues a command.

prototype.string: public function onChannelCommand(CoreChannel $sChannel, CoreUser $sNickname, string $sCommand, string $sArguments)

callback.name: onCTCPRequest
callback.description: Called when someone issues a CTCP request.

callback.name: onCTCPResponse
callback.description: Called when replies to a CTCP request.

callback.name: onPrivateMessage
callback.description: Called when someone private messages the bot.

callback.name: onNicknameChange
callback.description: Called when someone changes their name.

callback.name: onUserQuit
callback.description: Called when someone quits the network.

callback.name: onServerError
callback.description: Called when there is a fatal server error. The client usually is disconnected after this.

callback.name: onNicknameConflict
callback.description: Called whenever there is another user with the same nickname as the bot.

callback.name: onUnhandledEvent
callback.description: Called whenever the bot recieves an event/numeric that has no active handler.

function.name: getMessageObject
function.description: Returns an objectised view of an IRC message string.

variable.name: count
variable.description: This property returns the current amount of users in a channel. This class is also implements Countable, so this could be achieved from count().

function.name: getBanList
function.description: Returns the channel ban list.

example.output: Array ( [0] => stdClass Object ( [hostmaskString] => exampleUser!identifier@fakedomain.net [hostmaskObject] => stdClass Object ( [Nickname] => exampleUser [Username] => identifier [Hostname] => fakedomain.net ) [modeSetter] => Westie [modeTime] => 1307880973 ) [1] => stdClass Object ( [hostmaskString] => Jessica!identifier@fakedomain.net [hostmaskObject] => stdClass Object ( [Nickname] => Jessica [Username] => identifier [Hostname] => fakedomain.net ) [modeSetter] => Westie [modeTime] => 1307880968 ) )

function.name: getCreationTime
function.description: Returns the time the channel was created.

function.name: getExceptionList
function.description: Returns the channel exception list.

example.output: Array ( [0] => stdClass Object ( [hostmaskString] => exampleUser!identifier@fakedomain.net [hostmaskObject] => stdClass Object ( [Nickname] => exampleUser [Username] => identifier [Hostname] => fakedomain.net ) [modeSetter] => Westie [modeTime] => 1307880973 ) [1] => stdClass Object ( [hostmaskString] => Jessica!identifier@fakedomain.net [hostmaskObject] => stdClass Object ( [Nickname] => Jessica [Username] => identifier [Hostname] => fakedomain.net ) [modeSetter] => Westie [modeTime] => 1307880968 ) )

function.name: getInviteList
function.description: Returns the channel invited list.

example.output: Array ( [0] => stdClass Object ( [hostmaskString] => exampleUser!identifier@fakedomain.net [hostmaskObject] => stdClass Object ( [Nickname] => exampleUser [Username] => identifier [Hostname] => fakedomain.net ) [modeSetter] => Westie [modeTime] => 1307880973 ) [1] => stdClass Object ( [hostmaskString] => Jessica!identifier@fakedomain.net [hostmaskObject] => stdClass Object ( [Nickname] => Jessica [Username] => identifier [Hostname] => fakedomain.net ) [modeSetter] => Westie [modeTime] => 1307880968 ) )

function.name: isUserAdmin
function.description: Checks if the user in that channel has been granted Admin permissions.

function.name: isUserHalfOp
function.description: Checks if the user in that channel has been granted Half-Operator permissions.

function.name: isUserInChannel
function.description: Checks if the user is present in the channel.

function.name: isUserOp
function.description: Checks if the user in that channel has been granted Operator permissions.

function.name: isUserOwner
function.description: Checks if the user in that channel has been granted Operator permissions.

function.name: isUserVoice
function.description: Checks if the user in that channel has been granted Voice permissions.

function.name: __toString
function.description: String representation of the channel name. Refer to the PHP docs regarding magic methods.

variable.name: topic
variable.description: This property the current channel topic.

example.output: [ OUTRAGEbot ( no date ) ]> devel/support channel - :: @func [functionName] :: Github (latest): http://bit.ly/9AdHHb ::

variable.name: users
variable.description: This property the current users in the channel. Because this class implements ArrayAccess and Iterator, you can cycle through this object using foreach(), or access user's objects like an array.

example.output: Array ( [0] => stdClass Object ( [Nickname] => OUTRAGEbot [Usermode] => ) [1] => stdClass Object ( [Nickname] => Happycat [Usermode] => q ) ... )

function.name: Action
function.description:
Sends an action string to the specified channel.

More details on the optional $mOptionvalue are available from [Method CoreMaster::Raw].

example.output: * OUTRAGEbot walks away from the cow.

function.name: Format
function.description:
Formats a string to mIRC-like colours and formatting.

List of current modifiers:
  • Formatting modifiers
    • {b} - Emboldens the string past that point.
    • {i} - Puts the text into italics.
    • {r} - Cancels all formatting and colours after that point.
    • {u} - Underlines the string past that point.
    • {v} - Inverts the background and foreground colours.
  • Colour modifiers - these follow the scheme of either:

    {c:foregroundColour}
    {c:foregroundColour:backgroundColour}

    These names are case insensitive:
    • White
    • Black
    • DarkBlue
    • DarkGreen
    • Red
    • Brown
    • Purple
    • Orange
    • Yellow
    • Green
    • Teal
    • LightBlue
    • Blue
    • Pink
    • DarkGrey
    • Grey

example.source: $this->Format("{b}This string is in bold and {c:yellow}this text is yellow{r}, but this section has no custom formatting.");
example.output: This string is in bold and this text is yellow, but this section has no custom formatting.

function.name: Invite
function.description:
Invites a user to the channel.

More details on the optional $mOptionvalue are available from [Method CoreMaster::Raw].

function.name: Join
function.description:
Joins the bot to a channel.

More details on the optional $mOptionvalue are available from [Method CoreMaster::Raw].

function.name: Message
function.description:
Sends a message to either a channel or a IRC nickname.

More details on the optional $mOptionvalue are available from [Method CoreMaster::Raw].

function.name: Notice
function.description:
Sends a notice to either a channel or a IRC nickname.

More details on the optional $mOptionvalue are available from [Method CoreMaster::Raw].

function.name: Part
function.description:
Forces the bot to leave the channel.

More details on the optional $mOptionvalue are available from [Method CoreMaster::Raw].

function.name: Raw
function.description:
Sends a raw message to the IRC server.

List of possible types for $mOption:
  • Output options
    • SEND_DEF - option defined in configuration file
    • SEND_MAST - sent from the first defined IRC slave (in this case, the master)
    • SEND_CURR - sent from the current IRC child
    • SEND_ALL - sent from all at once
    • SEND_DIST - each message is distributed between each bot.
  • Output modification
    • FORMAT - formats the string in accordance with CoreMaster::Format()

Setting the $mOption argument null, will result in the second argument becoming SEND_DIST.

function.name: activateScript
function.description: Loads and activates a Script into the CoreMaster instance.

function.name: addChild
function.description: Adds a Socket instance to the bot. Returns the Handle name, which is important should you need to access this specific child again.

function.name: addCommandHandler
function.description:
Creates a command handler.

If the method is in a Script, then the first argument will not be the Master class.

function.name: addEventHandler
function.description:
One of the uses for addEventHandler is to listen into a built in event. You can do this by creating an event handler with the pre-registered callbacks, such as onChannelMessage().

Please note: If the callback isn't a member of any class that is a child of Script, then there will be an argument prepended that acts as the replacement for $this. This means that closures and global scope functions will have that extra argument.

function.name: addEventHandler
function.description:
One of the uses for addEventHandler is to listen for IRC numerics and commands. You can do this by creating an event handler, listening for perhaps, invite requests. The format codes, mentioned below, can be placed in any order, dependent on how they're needed.

List of format codes

  • c - Message parts as an array.
  • m - Message object. ([Method Core::getMessageObject])
  • p - The payload, or rather the bit after the semi-colon.
  • r - The raw, unparsed input string.
  • h - The parsed hostname, as an object.
  • u - User's nickname, as a string.

Please note: If the callback isn't a member of any class that is a child of Script, then there will be an argument prepended that acts as the replacement for $this. This means that closures and global scope functions will have that extra argument.

function.name: addTimer
function.description:
Creates a timer which will be executed.

List of options for $iRepeat:
  • 0 - Infinitely execute.
  • 1 - Repeat once
  • 2 - Repeat twice, and so on.

prototype.string: string CoreMaster::addTimer(callback $cCallback, integer $iInterval [, integer $iRepeat = 1 [, array $aArguments = array() ]])

function.name: deactivateScript
function.description: Removes a Script into the CoreMaster instance.

function.name: getActivatedScripts
function.description: Removes and reloads a Script into the CoreMaster instance.

function.name: getCallableMethods
function.description: Returns an array with a list of all callable methods in the Master instance of OUTRAGEbot.

function.name: getChannel
function.description: Returns the instance of [Class CoreChannel] for that channel.

function.name: getChannelList
function.description: Returns an array containing all the public channels on the network. Only available if the List module is enabled - it is by default. Also, the output won't be so "questionable" when really used...

example.output: Array ( [1] => stdClass Object ( [channel] => #android [count] => 24 [modes] => +ntrTf [topic] => here is a topic ) )

function.name: getCurrentSocket
function.description: Returns the current Socket instance.

function.name: getListOfChildren
function.description: Returns the list of Sockets connected to the Master class.

function.name: isResource
function.description:
Returns a match with relative Resource locations for a pattern.

Take note that this is Script specific, a Resource available in one Script is not accessable to another.

function.name: getNetworkConfiguration
function.description: Returns the network connection settings, or if $sConfigurationKey is provided, the specific key.

example.output: stdClass Object ( [name] => AndroidIRC [host] => irc.androidirc.org [port] => 6667 [owners] => raptor.typefish.co.uk [channels] => #OUTRAGEbot, #westie [scripts] => Evaluation [rotation] => 1 [quitmsg] => Bye, Said The Bot. [delimiter] => ~ [version] => OUTRAGEbot 2.0.0-Alpha-0 (rel. -today-); David Weston; http://outrage.typefish.co.uk [perform] => Array ( ) [ownerArray] => Array ( [0] => raptor.typefish.co.uk ) [scriptArray] => Array ( [0] => Evaluation ) [channelArray] => Array ( [0] => #OUTRAGEbot [1] => #westie ) )

function.name: getNextSocket
function.description: Returns the next Socket instance. This is in order of Socket creation.

function.name: getObject
function.description: Returns an instance of CoreUser or CoreChannel for the requested string.

function.name: getResource
function.description:
Returns an instance of [Class CoreResource] for that resource.

Take note that this is Script specific, a Resource available in one Script is not accessable to another.

function.name: getServerConfiguration
function.description: Returns the server settings, or if $sConfigurationKey is provided, the specific key.

example.output:
stdClass Object ( [CMDS] => KNOCK,MAP,DCCALLOW,USERIP [UHNAMES] => 1 [NAMESX] => 1 [SAFELIST] => 1 [HCN] => 1 [MAXCHANNELS] => 100 [CHANLIMIT] => #:100 [MAXLIST] => b:60,e:60,I:60 [NICKLEN] => 30 [CHANNELLEN] => 32 [TOPICLEN] => 307 [KICKLEN] => 307 [AWAYLEN] => 307 [MAXTARGETS] => 20 [WALLCHOPS] => 1 [WATCH] => 128 [WATCHOPTS] => A [SILENCE] => 15 [MODES] => 12 [CHANTYPES] => # [PREFIX] => (qaohv)~&@%+ [ChannelModes] => Array ( [0] => beI [1] => kfL [2] => lj [3] => psmntirRcOAQKVCuzNSMTG )
[CHANMODES] => beI,kfL,lj,psmntirRcOAQKVCuzNSMTG [NETWORK] => irc.sc [CASEMAPPING] => ascii [EXTBAN] => ~,cqnr [ELIST] => MNUCT [STATUSMSG] => ~&@%+ [EXCEPTS] => 1 [INVEX] => 1 )

function.name: getSocketConfiguration
function.description: Returns the socket settings, or if $sConfigurationKey is provided, the specific key.

function.name: getUser
function.description: Returns the instance of [Class CoreUser] for that user.

function.name: getWhoisData
function.description: Returns an object containing all the user information. Only available if the Whois module is enabled - it is by default.

example.output: stdClass Object ( [address] => icarus.typefish.co.uk [away] => false [channels] => Array ( [0] => &#android [2] => &#php [3] => #services [4] => @#opers [5] => #countr [6] => #relations [7] => +#music [8] => ~#OUTRAGEbot ) [helper] => true [idleTime] => 0 [ircOp] => true [nickname] => Westie [realname] => David Weston [serverAddress] => nl.irc.sc [serverName] => irc.sc [signonTime] => 1313004064 [username] => westie )

function.name: isAdmin
function.description: Checks if the user is a Bot administrator. Nothing to do with channel rights.

example.output: It looks like this user is actually an admin!

function.name: isResource
function.description:
Checks if that Resource exists.

Take note that this is Script specific, a Resource available in one Script is not accessable to another.

function.name: isUserAdmin
function.description: Checks if the user in that channel has been granted Admin permissions.

function.name: isUserHalfOp
function.description: Checks if the user in that channel has been granted Half-Operator permissions.

function.name: isUserOp
function.description: Checks if the user in that channel has been granted Operator permissions.

function.name: isUserOwner
function.description: Checks if the user in that channel has been granted Operator permissions.

function.name: isUserVoice
function.description: Checks if the user in that channel has been granted Voice permissions.

function.name: reactivateScript
function.description: Removes and reloads a Script into the CoreMaster instance.

function.name: removeChild
function.description: Removes the Socket from the instance. The first instance cannot be removed, ever. That would just be stupid.

function.name: removeEventHandler
function.description: Remove an event or command handler. There is no need to call this when a script is unloaded, because the software automatically scans for these handlers, and removes them beforehand.

function.name: isResource
function.description:
Removes that Resource.

Take note that this is Script specific, a Resource available in one Script is not accessable to another.

function.name: removeTimer
function.description: Removes a timer from being called.

function.name: replyCTCPMessage
function.description: Responds to a CTCP message.

function.name: requestCTCPMessage
function.description: Requests a CTCP message.

function.name: stripAll
function.description: Removes all formatting and colouring codes from the input string.

function.name: stripColour
function.description: Removes all colouring codes from the input string.

function.name: stripFormat
function.description: Removes all formatting codes from the input string.

function.name: triggerEvent
function.description:
Fires an event to the Scripts, and to any event handlers that have been hooked to this particular event.
You can find a list of all callbacks and their arguments here.

function.name: Read
function.description: Returns the contents of a resource.

example.output: [whatever is in your resource, I suppose]

function.name: Write
function.description: Either wipes the file and writes with new contents, or appends to the file.

function.name: isNew
function.description: Returns a boolean value on whether the file was just created or not.

function.name: modifyTime
function.description: Returns a boolean value on whether the file was just created or not. Resistant to cache problems.

function.name: __toString
function.description: Returns a string representation of the resources location on the computer. Useful with native PHP file functions.

variable.name: address
variable.description: This property returns the user's address.

variable.name: away
variable.description: This property checks if the user is away or not.

variable.name: channels
variable.description: This property returns an array of all the channels this person is on, along with their channel modes.

variable.name: helper
variable.description: This property checks if the user is available as an IRC helper.

variable.name: idleTime
variable.description: This property returns how many seconds the user has been idle.

variable.name: ircOp
variable.description: This property checks if the user is an IRC operator.

variable.name: nickname
variable.description: This property returns the user's nickname. Rather superfluous (you used the nickname to access this...) but it's provided here for completeness.

variable.name: realname
variable.description: This property returns the user's real name. Well, that's when they give real names...

variable.name: serverAddress
variable.description: This property returns the IRC server's address that this user is connected to.

variable.name: serverName
variable.description: This property returns the IRC server's network name that this user is connected to.

variable.name: signonTime
variable.description: This property returns in a timestamp, when the user signed on to the network.

variable.name: username
variable.description: This property returns the user's username.

function.name: version
function.description: This method returns the user's client version.
